channel.title: QLD weather news | The Courier Mail
channel.description: Breaking News Headlines for Brisbane and Queensland | Courier Mail

item.title: ‘Dangerous cocktail’ of extreme weather looming
item.description: FEWER cyclones are likely to hit Queensland this summer but a “dangerous cocktail” of hot and dry weather will bring more extreme bushfires.

item.title: Why it’s so cold in Brisbane right now
item.description: THE southeast is shivering through a sudden cold snap, with temperatures dropping to around 14C, with the wind chill factor making it feel closer to 12C on Saturday morning.

item.title: Video: Hail hits Brisbane suburbs
item.description: QUEENSLAND is expected to see more of the much needed rain this weekend after thunderstorms and hail hit parts of southeast Queensland yesterday.

item.title: WATCH: Hail smashes southeast as storms loom
item.description: SOME of the driest parts of the Darling Downs have been hit by rain and hail today.

item.title: Cooler conditions but fire threat still high
item.description: COOLER temperatures will begin to ease bushfire conditions across Queensland’s southeast corner from today, but the fire threat remains very high.

item.title: House destroyed as bushfire invades town
item.description: AT LEAST one house appears to have been destroyed in a dangerous fire currently burning in Laidley.

item.title: Firies prepare for worst as Qld towns hit 40C
item.description: QUEENSLAND firefighters are bracing for dangerous conditions on Tuesday, with crews already battling more than 20 blazes across the state.

item.title: Prepare to leave: Two bushfires threaten homes
item.description: Firefighters are throwing everything they can at several big blazes in hot, windy Queensland as they urge people to prepare for fire danger.

item.title: Fire danger flares as mercury soars
item.description: FIREFIGHTERS battling several big blazes in hot, windy weather in Queensland are urging people to prepare for fire danger.

item.title: Temperatures, fire danger to soar across southeast Qld
item.description: TEMPERATURES soaring to the high 30Cs accompanied by hot, dry northwesterly winds are set to push Fire Danger Ratings to "Severe" across Queensland's southeast coast during the next two days.
